intro: Cyrtandra bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan mountain heliconia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spiral-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as montane forests. Its leaves are broad and lanceolate, often with a waxy texture. Cyrtandra bulusanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
